text:
how to create a code block in markdown?
Sure, you can create a code block in Markdown by using three backticks (`) before and after your code. Here is an example:

```python
print("Hello World!")
```

This will render as follows:

```python
print("Hello World!")
```

Note that the language of the code (like 'python' in this case), must be indicated immediately after the opening backtick. This indicates what type of syntax highlighting you'd like to use when displaying your code.

Also, note that it's important to not include any spaces between the backticks and the language name.

If you want multiple code blocks, just make sure they're each separated by at least one blank line.
